content.raw:
While it makes sense to supply colors, I think it detracts from aesthetic value…

Can the coloring be stripped from this text? If a user wants to know what RGBA looks like, should we just point them to a reference page, possibly with an interactive color wheel?
content.html:
While it makes sense to supply colors, I think it detracts from aesthetic value…

Can the coloring be stripped from this text? If a user wants to know what RGBA looks like, should we just point them to a reference page, possibly with an interactive color wheel?

pullrequest.title: SDF Spec tutorial: Visuals and Collisions

content.raw:
AFAIK, Markdown should be irregular expressions, and thus should support nesting. Is this possible?

```
[`<ambient/>`](url...)
```
content.html:
AFAIK, Markdown should be irregular expressions, and thus should support nesting. Is this possible?

[`<ambient/>`](url...)

pull_request.title: SDF Spec tutorial: Visuals and Collisions

pullrequest.title: SDF Spec tutorial: Visuals and Collisions

content.raw: The section discussing `<material>` tags is largely taken from @sloretz's fantastic tutorial http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=color_model. One thing to note is that the `<specular>` component of materials does not currently work in [Gazebo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/2120/specular-material-not-working) as described in the tutorial.
content.html: The section discussing <material> tags is largely taken from @sloretz's fantastic tutorial http://gazebosim.org/tutorials?tut=color_model. One thing to note is that the <specular> component of materials does not currently work in Gazebo as described in the tutorial.
